questions.question_text:
Ursa Major Sola is creating an employee experience portal.
Using audience targeting, how should the Experience designer set it up so that different pages in the portal appear to different departments and roles within those departments?

choices.C: By using Profile criteria and selecting the Service profile
choices.A: By using User criteria and selecting appropriate user fields on CRM objects
choices.D: By using Location criteria and specifying which IP address applies to each department and domain
choices.B: By using Domain criteria and creating custom domains for each department or role to access the portal

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. By using User criteria and selecting appropriate user fields on CRM objects.

This option allows the Experience designer to target specific users based on their attributes, such as department or role, stored in CRM objects. By selecting the relevant user fields on CRM objects, the designer can effectively target different pages to different departments and roles within those departments.

choices.D: Add a Partner Community profile to a Sharing Set and add Opportunities as an object in the Sharing Set.
choices.B: Create a criteria-based sharing rule with a Partner Community role.
choices.A: Create an owner-based sharing rule with a Customer Community User.
choices.C: Add a Customer Community Plus profile to a Sharing Set and add Opportunities as an object in the Sharing Set.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Custom community licenses dont have access to Opportunity , hence answer is BD . Check https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=platform.users_license_types_communities.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: BD
Partner Community: Business-to-business experiences that need access to sales data such as partner relationship management. -> Sales Data contains Opportunity

Selected Answer: BD
The Opportunities object is only available on the Partner Community and Channel Account licenses. Not for the Customer Community license.

Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) is building a digital experience for its independent researchers who will be collaborating with NTO’s staff and other researchers on their research work.
Which user visibility setting needs to be enabled at a minimum?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer
The question doesn't say anything about Guest users.

B is correct:
To enable the installers to collaborate with their co-workers and UMS staff, UMS needs to enable Portal User Visibility. This is a user visibility setting that allows portal users to see other portal users who have the same role or a role below them in the role hierarchy. This also allows portal users to see internal users who are above them in the role hierarchy. Portal User Visibility can be enabled in the Sharing Settings page in Setup.

A is correct.
Independent researchers are not tied to NTO. So they will visit as guests. To see and collaborate with NTO staff, the minimum visibility they require is Guest User visibility.

"Guest User Visibility: Lets guest users see other members of this site setting controls whether user sharing is available for unauthenticated (guest) users in your Experience Cloud sites. You grant guest user visibility on a site-by-site basis by selecting Let guest users see other members of this site, with turns visibility on or off."
